result.execSummary:
The defendant Reavon W. Taylor was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant granted credit for 222 days served and was found to be eligible after 2 years of confinement for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program. Sentence to be served consecutively to any other prison sentence.
Consecutive to: Sentence to be served consecutively to any other prison sentence

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant is ordered to pay the $250.00 DNA surcharge, provide a sample for testing through the Dept. of Corrections as required in felony convictions.
Costs to be paid on a schedule established by the agent.
Defendant shall attend counseling, treatments, programming, evaluations as deemed appropriate by the agent releasing all records to the agent upon request

The defendant shall have no contact with the Victims Family, specifically M.C.Jr,V.C. or F.C.  of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way.  

Defendant shall not possess or consume any medication or drug except as may be specifically prescribed by a medical professional for defendant, and then shall be taken only as prescribed.  

The defendant shall submit to random urine/PBT testing as required by the agent .
The defendant is to submit to an Alcohol and Other Drug Assessment (AODA) and follow the recommendations, releasing the findings to the agent.

supervisions.notes: The defendant shall pay Department of Correction fees as directed by the agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

11:43 AM Attorney Kerra Stumbris appeared on behalf of the State and Defendant, Reavon W. Taylor, in custody, appeared with Attorney Matthew Prior.   Motion for sentence modification - DOC did not give him the proper credit for the ERP.  Asking to be let out on Extended Supervision due to DOC's error.  Court don't think he can say the DOC is wrong.  Court believes that he cannot do what the defense is asking for. Court finds that no new factors have been demonstrated to allow for sentence modification.   DOC is the only ones that can decide when to put him in the program.  Attorney Prior has 30 days that he can prove his case and the Court will hold a hearing.
Motion hearing on October 21, 2019 at 11:35 am.
